ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Su's Bazaar problems... ;-) (was Re: Dinosaur)
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi! Sorry I took so long to respond. Been busy doing construction/cleanup/repair at the house and junk. I have a 40Gb primary and 120Gb secondary drive. I
ygData.messageBody:
Hi!
Sorry I took so long to respond. Been busy doing construction/cleanup/repair
at the house and junk.
I have a 40Gb primary and 120Gb secondary drive.
I started having even worse problems where my character got stuck after
going LD in various zones and then had to wait for a week for a walkout from
a GM. I could get my other characters into the same zone and I had no active
character warnings. I deleted and repatched zone files, deleted skins
folder, deleted eqclient, deleted all files with that characters name.
reloaded all the stuff. rebooted. defragged, diskcleanup, scandisk.. and I
still had the problem. After the umpteenth walkout and several calls to tech
support they told me there were brand new drivers for my video card to dl.
So I dled those drivers and so far haven't had problems. But I haven't
played enough since then to find out if the problem is completely gone. The
bazaar problem I think is just because my connection is too slow to handle
the lag from too many people in the zone and I just go LD.
Thanks for the suggestions though. :-)
luv,
-Su


> Su, i just had another idea about your Bazaar problems:
>
> how much space do you have availible on your harddisk?
> is there enough room for your swapfile?
>
> besides, if you enable EQ texture caching, it will also
> eat up harddisk space.
>
> one more thing to add: when did you run defrag the last
> time?
>
>
> just an idea...
>
> - bilt
>
> --
> Biltilie Dwimmerlaik, lvl 57 gnome magician, Tarew Marr
